subject: Re: [junit] incompatible types
msgSnippet: Hi Larry Thank you for your reply. I tried use MyTest instead of Test as class name, it shows me the same error. I tried my TestSuite class--as following, it
messageBody:
Hi Larry

Thank you for your reply. I tried use MyTest instead of Test as class name,
it shows me the same error. I tried my TestSuite class--as following, it
shows me the same error;

===================================================

import junit.framework.*;

public class AllTests extends TestSuite
{
public static void main (String[] args)
{
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}
public static Test suite ( )
{
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new TestSuite(MyTest.class));
return suite; /////// shows same error here----espect Test
but return TestSuite
}
}
=================================
The problem is strange. What could be wrong? Configuration?(I added
junit.jar in my classpath).

I appreciate all your helps.
Thanks,
Nancy

----- Original Message -----
From: "Tambascio, Larry" <ltambascio@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, February 28, 2003 3:35 PM
Subject: RE: [junit] incompatible types


> Hi,
>
> You named your class "Test". This conflicts with junit.framework.Test.
Try
> naming your class something like TestNancy, and see if that helps.
>
> Good luck,
> -Larry
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nancy [mailto:logmail2003@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 28, 2003 3:22 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] incompatible types
>
>
> hi
>
> I have the following code:
>
> =======================================
>
> import junit.framework.*;
> import java.util.*;
>
> public class Test extends TestCase {
> ArrayList a;
> public Test(String name) {
> super(name);
> }
> protected void setUp() {
> a = new ArrayList();
> }
>
> public void test() {
> assertTrue(a.size() == 8);
> }
>
> public static Test suite() {
> return new TestSuite(Test.class); //This line shows
incompatible
> types error
> }
>
> public static void main(String[] args) {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> }
> }
> ====================================================
>
> When the above code was compiled, I got the error saying: " incompatible
> types found: junit.framework.TestSuite required : Test, return new
> TestSuite(Test.class)".
>
> My understanding is: Test extends TestSuite. I am not sure why it
complains
> at following line -----
>
> return new TestSuite(Test.class);
>
> I appreciate your help.
> Thanks,
> Nancy
>
>
